ago uh we launched SNS mobile push it was our first foray into doing something
special something unique for mobile developers to help solve their problems uh since then uh We've been on quite a

that and I'll use quotes mobile is growing in all directions uh of course mobile apps
continue published mobile apps continue to grow at a rapid clip uh this year we passed 3 million published mobile apps
just between Apple and the Google stores alone if you fold in the Amazon app store and and uh the Microsoft store
Windows store were over 4 million apps in the market but the story has gone beyond mobile
mobile platforms now are doing much more than just mobile devices and tablets
last year TVs became uh an opportunity for mobile developers with the launch of Amazon TV or Fire TV uh this year we've
got the Apple TV out there uh and developers are super enthusiastic about taking their apps uh and experiences and
putting those on the big screen uh not only are they working on the big screen now they're working on the small screen
uh and and watch apps are increasingly popular there's already more than 10,000 published apps uh for the Apple watch
and more on Android gear uh in addition to that car apps are starting to come
out so mobile developers have a really huge challenge here there's an increasing number of apps that people
are clamoring for on their mobile devices and they've got all these opportunities to go elsewhere but each of those is a little bit
different so not only are the numbers of mobile apps and the numbers of platforms GR growing but apps are getting much
more complex actually 5 years ago we started with very simple mobile apps um
not too much service connectivity and those have evolved today to really complex Beast we did a tear down
recently of the top thousand apps and found that on average these apps had at least 11 sdks in them some as many as 30
or even 40 sdks in them they're connecting their own custom backends they're connecting all kinds of
analytics service advertising storage push you name it there's a lot that goes
into these mobile apps these days and it's a big task for mobile developers to build these quickly and
easily I mentioned that we started AWS and mobile a couple of years ago when we launched SNS mobile push since then
we've added a full portfolio of services we added an analytics service we added
an identity service a data synchronization service we added an API service a serverless
compute backend and earlier this year we launched a device testing service so now
mobile developers tell us hey AWS you've got what I need but it's complex I'm
trying to build complex apps and you're not making that simpler uh if you go to the AWS Management console you know
there are a lot of choices for what to put into your mobile app and then once you find what you want
it's not always easy to wire those up let's look at a simple example I'm building a mobile app and I want to put
a sign-in screen in my app this is not differentiating I just need people to sign in so I'm going to use Amazon
Cognito so I can issue temporary limited privilege credentials to the app so it can get access to my backend so I start
with the AWS mobile SDK well then I need identity provider sdks I'm going to need
one for Google and I'm going to need one for Facebook and then I've got got to wire up my own back end and then I need
a signin screen and I need all that integration code between those sdks and my signin screen to make it work all of
this for something that adds minimal value to my app and is a distraction from the experiences I'm trying to
build and we realized as we went through this ourselves that there has to be a better way with this P full portfolio of
services now to build mobile apps so we set out to build something new this
year if you will we wanted to reinvent the experience for mobile developers on
AWS when we did this we said one goal for ourselves which was we wanted mobile
developers from the time they landed on the console to the time they had a working app in xcode or Android Studio
we wanted that time to be less than 10 minutes which was an audacious goal from where we started and we set four
underlying tenants for the experience we wanted to build the first one was we wanted an
integrated console now our team loves to play table tennis but we don't want to make our developers ping pong across all
the service consoles you can go to the IM console the S3 console the SNS console all that is a lot of work and
distracting from mobile developers so we wanted to consolidate this in one integrated
experience second we wanted to do more than just give you sdks and services we
heard loud and clear that you want to come combine things into actual features that power your app
experiences so we wanted to prepackage things that combine multiple services
and much more client implementation beyond the raw or low-level
sdks third we wanted to take care of all the service provisioning for you um we
wanted to keep you in that single integrated console we also wanted you to take advantage of all the security best
practices that AWS offers but we didn't want make you have to learn all the ins and outs of it and we didn't want you to
have to dive into the IM stuff on your first visit to the AWS console so we
wanted to automatically provision all that with zero touch and finally and the most important
step honestly is we wanted to give you actual working code that works with your provision Services immediately we didn't
want some static sample apps that had been written two years ago that hadn't been updated we wanted you to have
something that immediately worked with what we just provisioned on your behalf the result and you'll see it in a
few minutes is really something you can get started within 10 minutes depending on the features you add it can be three
minutes honestly um and it's extremely quick to get started now on AWS so let's
take a quick tour of the experience I'll give you a quick overview of the features and then John can come and demo
The Experience so the AWS mobile hub is a Project based approach to building
mobile app app s and we look at five sort of life cycle or stages of development we start with letting you
select and configure features to add into your app then we let you download the source code to take advantage of
those features in your mobile app once you've built your app we let you test it
on real devices in the cloud to make sure that you've gotten all the bugs out once it's tested and you've published we
give you an analytics dashboard so you can see how your app is doing in the market is you should is usage growing is
monetization growing and so forth and finally because this is built on AWS we
don't to hide all of the services we provisioned for you we want to give you access to those when you're ready and
that's the resources panel where you can dive into specific things that we've provisioned on your behalf if you want
to do Advanced configuration so those are the five steps let me talk about the features
that we offer for a minute so these are the six features we let you add to your mobile app
there's a user signin feature which lets you configure uh user signin optional
mandatory or not at all uh with public identity providers and your own identity system we let you add push notifications
to your app we have an app content delivery feature which lets you store
application assets like resource files or media files and then send those down
to your app when you're ready and we can do that through a CDN there's a user data storage feature
which lets you store files and also key value pairs so you can customize your user's experience and store all their
data in the cloud for processing there's an app analytics feature which lets you
track what's going on with your users and then there's a cloud logic feature which lets you run backend code in the
cloud without having to manage infrastructure so let's dive into each of those
quickly the user sign in feature uh as I mentioned has options you don't have to
make your user sign in if you don't we'll still issue you temporary limited privilege credentials so those guest
users can get access to your backend and your AWS Services securely but if you do
want them to sign in for other reasons you can make that optional or mandatory you can log in with Facebook and you'll
see in the console that uh Google Twitter and log in with Amazon will all
be coming very soon uh or you can log in with your own identity system and you
simply put in your API Keys uh depending on the provider um and click save and
you're off in running the sample app that we give you gives you the full sign-in page that you can use for your
app or you can customize it with your own background images uh whatever and includes all the integration code
between that sign-in screen and all these other sdks this feature is powered by Amazon Cognito
identity the second feature we offer is push notification
uh and here you have multiple options you can choose the Google Cloud messaging platform you can choose the uh
iOS either the the dev or the prod environment um and you put in your keys
and you're off and running you can create topics to subscribe your users to so you can publish messages to groups of
users uh with one publish action or you can send individual messages to
particular users this feature is powered by on SNS and the quick start app
includes all of the code you need to register your app with the Push Services
whether that's Google or Apple and then the app will take your tokens that it receives and it'll register those with
Amazon SNS the third feature is app content
delivery as I mentioned this is for storing things like an audio file or
images for background or big resource files that you couldn't put you couldn't bundle with your uh App Store submission
we'll store these in S3 for you and then if you like we'll create a cloudfront distribution so you can cache those
files at the edges around the world and deliver very quickly to your apps when they come online uh this is powered by
S3 and cloudfront uh and the quickart app includes an on device cache uh and
gives you a full example of how you might download and cache those in the background of your
app okay the fourth feature uh user data storage uh this is as simple to
configure as on or off don't have to do anything else uh and there's two actually features within this one uh
first you can store files for your users in the cloud things like photos uh you can store those in a public folder which
everyone who has the app might have access to or you can have private folders for each user uh so that uh if
I've got photos and it's not a social app um those are uh limited access only
to the users that stored those files uh in addition to files we provide key value pair storage you can save things
like game State uh or user profile settings or preferences uh and then if a
user signs in we can sync those across the user across that user's devices so
this is powered by uh Amazon S3 and Cognito sync uh and the quick start app
includes examples of both uh there's a file explorer uh as well as a settings
panel that can show you how to use those
features okay app analytics very straightforward yes or no um it includes
uh instrumentation of standard session events when does the St session start
when does it end uh it also uh allows you to do monetization events so you can
track revenue and custom events uh so you can track levels in a game or particular uh things you want to track
that are unique to your app um this feature is powered by Amazon mobile analytics and the dashboard uh is
actually immediately accessible in the mobile hub uh screen that John will show
you in a second okay finally the sixth feature uh
is cloud logic uh and this is designed to let you run uh Cloud functions in the
background with AWS Lambda you can write functions in JavaScript or Java uh or
now a python um and you simply paste your code and AWS Lambda will take care
of all the hardware provisioning and scaling necessary to run those functions
uh in response to calls from your mobile app uh the sample app that John will
show you shows uh how you can invoke those uh functions directly from your mobile app pass it parameters and get
return values okay so those are the six
features you simply go through those a lot of those are just yes no do I want this do I want that a couple of keys you
got to paste in there then after you've configured what you want it's time to download code and as I mentioned the AWS
mobile hub actually has a code generator service behind it so it takes what you've selected and it takes the
services we've provisioned on your behalf as a result of that and produces a customized xcode or Android Studio
project with all the source you need uh to immediately uh get up and running you
